definition[0]: a unanimous decision, vote, agreement etc is one in which all the people involved agree
example[0]: It was decided by a unanimous vote that the school should close.
example[1]: The decision to appoint Matt was almost unanimous.
example[2]: The banks were unanimous in welcoming the news.
definition[2]: a unanimous decision, statement etc is one that everyone agrees with
example[3]: If the value of the shares is not to be determined by the auditors, there has to be unanimous agreement of the shareholders.
example[4]: The vote in favour of the merger was unanimous.
